definition: equally matched/about the same
(negative prefix)/not/no
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: They rivalled one another in their appetites .
I'd say the two players are prettily even.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这两个选手不相上下。

sentences.english: The smell of cooking competed with tobacco.
sentences.chinese: 烹调的气味和烟草味不相上下。

sentences.english: The experience of our side and the youthful determination of the other balance each other out.
sentences.chinese: 我方经验丰富，对方年轻气盛决心大，两者不相上下。

sentences.english: His collection of books was commensurate with that of a town library.
sentences.chinese: 他的藏书量与镇上图书馆不相上下。

sentences.english: Muskrat fur almost equals beaver fur in quality.
sentences.chinese: 麝鼠皮在质量上几乎和海獭皮不相上下。

sentences.english: Old stone young and Luo Daquan compare marksmanship, equal.
sentences.chinese: 陈石仔和罗大全比枪法，不相上下。

sentences.english: And the prices are the same now.
sentences.chinese: 此外，现在价格也不相上下了。

sentences.english: Two rounds, the strength and the idol group are equally matched.
sentences.chinese: 两轮唱罢，实力和偶像组不相上下。

sentences.english: Men are all alike in their promises. It is only in their deeds that they differ. qw.
sentences.chinese: 人们的承诺不相上下，只有行动才能显出差异。

sentences.english: Helen is quite equal to Jack in brains.
sentences.chinese: 在智力方面海伦和杰克完全不相上下。

sentences.english: This makes rates competitive with those of Jordan and Syria.
sentences.chinese: 这让工资水平与约旦和叙利亚不相上下。

sentences.english: This effect, with interest influence on the thoughts and feelings be roughly the same.
sentences.chinese: 这个影响，同利害关系对思想感情的影响不相上下。

sentences.english: The stiffness and air permeability of the two fabrics are similary.
sentences.chinese: 在刚柔性和透气性方面两者不相上下。

definition: lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
not to know one's place
not inferior in any respect
not much difference
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
lit. to have no time for civilities (idiom)/fig. not to be outdone/not to yield to one's opponents
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to both share the limelight/to both have an equal share of
slightly better/a cut above
to draw (a competition)/to fight to a standstill
almost on a par
well-matched/equally matched
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
not to be inferior in any aspects (idiom)/to surpass/to outdo/(derog.) to be even worse
pinyin: you3 guo4 zhi1 er2 wu2 bu4 ji2

definition: similar
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
